definition: to flirt
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
feeling/emotion/passion/situation

sentences.english: But within reason, flirting is part and parcel of our daily lives.
sentences.chinese: 但当然了，调情是我们日常生活中不可分割的一部分。

sentences.english: All over the world, there are classes that teach people how to flirt.
sentences.chinese: 在世界上，到处都有教人们如何调情的课程。

sentences.english: Fey enjoy sexual and emotional dalliances with creatures of all kinds.
sentences.chinese: 精类生物喜爱和各种生物调情并勾引他们。

sentences.english: She flirts with every handsome man she meets.
sentences.chinese: 她和所遇到的每个美男子调情。

sentences.english: Because without realizing it, you are an expert in flirting and body language.
sentences.chinese: 因为你没有注意到，你是调情和肢体语言的专家。

sentences.english: He felt sick of the broad words of his colleagues' flirting.
sentences.chinese: 他同事调情时那些漫无边际的话使他感到呕心。

sentences.english: Drinking wine by glass is like flirting, while uncorking a bottle of wine is like having a love affair.
sentences.chinese: 喝单杯葡萄酒像调情，开瓶则是和一瓶酒谈恋爱。

sentences.english: Belles and beaux philandered in the hotels.
sentences.chinese: 美貌女子和花花公子在旅馆里调情。

sentences.english: He spent his time philandering with the girls in the village.
sentences.chinese: 他把时间花在和村子里的姑娘们调情上了。

sentences.english: The girl flirted with other men, stoking her boy friend's jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 这个女孩跟其他男人调情，让她的男友妒火中烧。

sentences.english: Do not make it seem like your flirting with them.
sentences.chinese: 别搞的好像你和她们在调情。

sentences.english: Have tickle fights, go to a comedy club, make-out in a photo booth.
sentences.chinese: 追着挠痒痒，去看喜剧演出，到电话亭打个调情电话。

sentences.english: If you flirt with me, I’ll have to leave.
sentences.chinese: 如果你要跟我调情，我立刻就走。

sentences.english: She was propositioned by a stranger at the party.
sentences.chinese: 她在晚会上被一个陌生人调情。

sentences.english: She kept playing footsie with me under the table.
sentences.chinese: 她一直和我在桌底下偷偷地碰脚调情。

sentences.english: And she would flirt with every man there.
sentences.chinese: 她还要跟那个县里的每一个男人调情。

definition: to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
vague/ambiguous/equivocal/dubious
to provoke/to entice/to lure/to tantalize/to tease/to titillate
to carry on a clandestine love affair
to make love
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
sex/lovemaking
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
to seduce/to tempt
to make sheep eyes at/to cast amorous glances at
to take liberties with a woman/to dally/to assail a woman with obscenities
to kiss
appointment/engagement/date/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]/to arrange to meet
bed and bamboo sleeping mat/(fig.) bed as a place for intimacy
lovers' rendezvous/tryst
lit. eyes and eyebrows come and go (idiom); to make eyes/to exchange flirting glances with sb
